content.description:
A superb problem over an awkward and scary landing.  

  Stand start at the base of a good right trending flake system and follow the system up to it's apex at around 10-15 feet.    From here cross up to a slopey hold above you head and position your feet for a large unwind dynamic move up and out right to a large flat rail. Not committing or falling here could have severe consequences. Once the jug is latched, match and do a few more hard moves up to the lip of the boulder/cliff. The top of the rock is slopey and not as good as you'd like. Stay tight and figure out a way to mantle the beast.
content.protection: If your name is Vasya, you don't need any. Otherwise, don't try and be a hero. 8-10 pads.
content.location: Right side of the Monsters Crag. Just right of "Doctor No".

content.description: This area rarely sees any attention from boulderers, but it seems the cliff band has yet picked out with a boulderer's vision. Currently, there is one boulder problem on the cliff band, with potential for a handful of others. There are also a few boulders scattered just below the cliff that may have been climbed before as warm ups for projects on the big wall.
